void add_entry(int key, int value) {

    int hash = key % HASH_SIZE;

    // search the linked list in map[hash] for the existing key

    struct map_entry *e = map[hash];

    while (e) {

        if (e->key == key) {

            e->value += value;

            return;

        }

        e = e->next;

    }

    // If not found, allocate new element:

    struct map_entry *new_entry = (struct map_entry*)malloc(sizeof(struct map_entry));

    new_entry->key = key;

    new_entry->value = value;

    new_entry->next = map[hash];

    map[hash] = new_entry;

}

int get_entry(int key) {

    int hash = key % HASH_SIZE;

    struct map_entry *e = map[hash];

    while (e) {

        if (e->key == key) return e->value;

        e = e->next;

    }

    return 0;

}

#include <stdio.h>

#include <stdlib.h>

#include <inttypes.h>

#define HASH_SIZE 1000019  // some prime number larger than N

struct map_entry {

    int key;

    int value;

    struct map_entry *next;

};

struct map_entry *map[HASH_SIZE]; 

void init_map() {

    for(int i=0; i < HASH_SIZE; i++) map[i] = NULL;

}

void add_entry(int key, int delta) {

    int hash = key % HASH_SIZE;

    if (hash <0) hash += HASH_SIZE;

    // Find if key exists in the list

    struct map_entry** e = &map[hash];

    while (*e) {

        struct map_entry* current = *e;

        if (current->key == key) {

            current->value += delta;

            return;

        }

        e = &current->next;

    }

    // Not found, need to create new entry

    struct map_entry* new_entry = malloc(sizeof(struct map_entry));

    new_entry->key = key;

    new_entry->value = delta;

    new_entry->next = *e;

    *e = new_entry;

}

int get_entry(int key) {

    int hash = key % HASH_SIZE;

    if (hash <0) hash += HASH_SIZE;

    struct map_entry* e = map[hash];

    while (e) {

        if (e->key == key) return e->value;

        e = e->next;

    }

    return 0;

}

void cleanup_map() {

    for (int i=0; i<HASH_SIZE; i++) {

        struct map_entry* e = map[i];

        while (e) {

            struct map_entry* next = e->next;

            free(e);

            e = next;

        }

        map[i] = NULL;

    }

}

void solve() {

    // Get the inputs

    int n, m;

    scanf("%d%d", &n, &m);

    if (m ==0) {

        // But problem says m>=1 probably.

        // handle however;

        return;

    }

    int a[n];

    for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {

        scanf("%d", &a[i]);

    }

    init_map();

    int base =0;

    int64_t ans =0; // ans is long in Java, so need to be 64 bit.

    for(int i=0; i <n; i++) {

        int current_a = a[i];

        int mod_val = (current_a % m + m) % m;

        // compute new base temp:

        int temp = (base - mod_val + m) % m;

        base = temp;

        int key = (base + current_a) % m;

        // merge the key with +1:

        add_entry(key, 1);

        // ans += dp.get(base) in Java: get_entry(base)

        int val = get_entry(base);

        ans += val;

    }

    printf("%"PRId64"\n", ans);

    cleanup_map();

}

int main() {

    solve();

    return 0;

}
